data.title: Clean the ts yaml rules
Map edge shroud borders are extremely annoying
data.body:
While they might be more appealing from an aesthetic point of view, in D2k you can currently hide vehicles almost completely(!) below the "shroud" of map borders, and it's not that much better in the other mods, either. This has been bothering me for ages, I think it's long overdue we adressed this.

I think we should a) allow modders to disable the edge hiding in their mods, and b) fix it as far as possible in our shipping mods.

If we don't want to change the underlying logic, we should at least use custom shroud art offsets for map borders to reduce the actor-hiding as much as possible.

data.title: Improve score-screen
data.body:
compared to the original c&c-score-screens ... our output is pretty pathetic to be honest
games can take up to "hours" and people spend serious time playing openra ... so imo at the end of every game they should get something satisfying (no matter if they won or lost it)

what i mean by that is , a score-screen with animated bars (for kills , casualties ... experience/points) eventually animated logos ... nice (flashy?) colors ... just something worthy to be called "highscore" or "end-score-screen" everything fitting to the actually mod-theme of course ... 

@pchote  already brought up this idea multiple times on irc ... and here for references :

![score2640](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9139965/16545850/82c7d8d6-4137-11e6-8047-593e0d5a8714.gif)

data.title: Documented and exposed the control group sprites to lint testing
data.body: Not setting them up will cause problems to modders.

data.title: FNT font format support
data.body: The original games include their own fonts. See http://xhp.xwis.net/documents/ccfonts.txt for the file format. There are even editors for them: http://forums.cncnz.com/topic/8223-ra2yr-font-editor-released/

data.title: Added WithTextDecoration
data.body: All games from Dune 2000 onward seem to render these dynamically. This is required for https://github.com/OpenRA/ra2/issues/181. It will also ease localisation of the game https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/10475.

data.title: Fixed undisposed file and memory streams in ZipFile and surroundings
data.body: This tries to fix the defects from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/11482, which were detected by Coverity.

data.title: FileSystem.Mount: Use TryGetValue instead of directly accessing a value
data.body:
```
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Could not load mod 'foo'. Available mods: all, cnc, d2k, modchooser, ra, ts, ra2, pc
  at OpenRA.FileSystem.FileSystem.Mount (System.String name, System.String explicitName) [0x00074] in /Users/thill/projects/play/openra/OpenRA.Game//FileSystem/FileSystem.cs:115
```

This will help to speed up diagnosing issues like https://github.com/OpenRA/ra2/issues/243#issuecomment-230131995 in the future.

data.title: Added text based endgame statistics
data.body:
This adds a `/stats` command to the end game chat, which prints out Worms style player stats.

Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5360.

data.title: Replace GivesExperience.FriendlyFire and GivesBounty.Stances with ValidStances
data.body:
~~Depends on~~ #11482  has been merged.
Closes #11546

data.title: Refine the support power speech notifications setup
data.body:
- Cleans and completes the `notifications.yaml` file of cnc
- Removes empty fields (which default to `null` anyway)
- Adds support for `InsufficientPower`\- and `LaunchSpeechNotifications`
- Replaces references to filenames by references to the speech notifications

Followup of #11483.

data.title: Added ready checkbox for spectating admins
data.body:
Feature #10416

An admin is now able to spectate a game and is provided with a ready checkbox.
![ra](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2963387/16540205/fc82fbc2-4053-11e6-8d19-64a44798b561.png)

Game does not start until the spectating admin is ready.
![spec_admin_not_ready](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2963387/16540204/fade3e94-4053-11e6-9ca2-2f4329ac30ce.png)

An admin spectating still has the start game option.
![two_spectators](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2963387/16540206/fe09b4ea-4053-11e6-8485-4009549c0d56.png)

![cnc](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2963387/16540211/21c6033e-4054-11e6-8af1-2cf1e4d1aaae.png)

data.body: Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/11442.

data.title: Lower the case of the TechLevel in all rules.yaml files

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
Since #11364 the case of the `TechLevel`s is lower-case.
This prohibited building in several missions.

Also cleaned a bit up: Removed the `MapOptions` trait where it's not needed.

data.title: TD Balance Changes 06302016

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
These are the following changes for TD:

APC AA Gun projectile speed increase from 1c6 to 2c0.

Flame Tank damage vs light increase from 67 to 100.

Flame Tank explosion damage increase from 100 to 115.

Flame Tank damage spread increase from 341 to 400.

Repair Pad HP increase from 600 to 700.

Artillery Turn Speed increased from 2 to 4.

MCV HP increase from 950 to 1200.

data.title: Fix RA Grenadier damage versus Heavy armor

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
By increasing it by a factor of 5 (from a measly 5% to still-rather-low 25%).

Closes #11103.

data.title: OpenRA freezing every few seconds.
data.body:
Recently i have been having a bug where, once i have had it open for a game or two, OpenRA will start freezing for a couple of seconds, then resume for a few seconds, then freeze and so on. I have tried a fresh install and the freezing does not lead to a crash but while it is frozen i am unable to interact with OpenRA at all. The freezing also affects other players in multiplayer.

This is my system's specification:

data.title: Fix debris P03 template in TD jungle and snow terrain
data.body: Closes #11539.

data.title: Replace GivesExperience.FriendlyFire boolean with Stances
data.body:
`GivesBounty` already works that way.

Would make things more consistent and allow to disable giving experience for neutral actors, for example.

data.title: Overhaul RA installed content.
data.body:
This overhauls the RA asset extraction and downloads with a few goals in mind:
- Aftermath and C&C Desert assets are now managed by the content installer system.  This removes a bunch of binary assets from the repo and cuts almost 1MB from the windows installer download size (according to Appveyor).
- Downloaded asset packages provide identical content to the data installed from disc.
- lores.mix gives us a full set of low resolution icons for beacons and the observer interface.

Depends on #11536.
Closes #11537.

data.title: RA - Some fixes about Giant Ants
data.body: I recently realised they were crushable when playing my map. This doesn't makes sense and they are not in original game too. Also it had `GenericName:` of `Soldier` i made it `Ant` as we changed it for dogs too.

data.title: Divide map pool into categories
data.body:
With the map contest going on I've noticed that there are several categories of maps that are fun for different kind of players. To have a better overview of the different kind of maps and not clutter the map pool there could be several tabs. Like we have "Official Maps", "Custom Maps".

I would like to add 3 more categories (better names are welcome!)
- Official maps: maps that do not fit any catgory but still are good. Like Puddles Redux, Bad Neigbours, Barracuda, Haos Ridges, etc
- Competitive maps: all maps that qualify for competitive play
- Worldmaps (or scenic maps): this folder contains maps that look great and/or represent part of the world. These are maps that are not perfectly balanced/chockey, but they are fun to play for not so serious players who like to play a 'story'. Think of maps like: [Great Britain](http://resource.openra.net/maps/14631/), [The Netherlands](http://resource.openra.net/maps/12688/), [Earth 2064](http://resource.openra.net/maps/11928/), [Crimea landgrab](http://resource.openra.net/maps/14663/), and maybe too maps like this one: [Scarborough](http://resource.openra.net/maps/14805/) (not a good map, but pretty and fun for newbies?)
- Fun maps: all well modded maps or maps that don't fit in the other categories go there. Think of the minigames, God's Divide, best map evurrr, etc.
- Custom maps: all maps the user has added
